conclusion: Consider contributions from each of the four point charges to determine electric field strength at the intersection.
Charges +q are at points A and B; charges -q are at points C and D.
Distance from center to any vertex is L/âˆš2.
Electric field E due to point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Electric field due to +q at A and B is 2kq/L^2.
Electric field due to -q at C and D is -2kq/L^2.
Electric field due to +q points away; due to -q points towards charges.
Electric fields due to +q and -q are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction along diagonals.
Electric fields cancel each other out, resulting in zero electric field strength at the center.
